cards.back_flavor: Chiaki Asami lived with his parents in an unstable country on the brink of rebellion. Just a child, he was forced to watch as the ensuing chaos stole his family from him. Forming a small group with refugees including Akira Hojo, he attempted flee the country. Only the two of them had survived by the time they reached the new world of Arkham. Chiaki was disgusted by the state of society when he saw the broken city. He vowed to take the political reins of Arkham and steer it towards a brighter future. Criminals, the corrupt, and even the abyss itself be damned.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, Favor cards level 0-3, up to 5 other Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 3 Policy, 2 Push for Progress, On Borrowed Time, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Setup: You begin the game with your Policy cards on their Pending side.
cards.deck_requirements: size:30, card:40001, card:40002, card:40025, card:40026, card:40027, random:subtype:basicweakness
cards.name: Chiaki Asami
cards.text: Your cards with the Favor trait gain the Insight trait. Forced At the start of the round, flip all of your Policy cards to their Pending side. Flip your Policy card that has been on its Pending side the longest to its Enacted side. [elder_sign] effect: +1. After this test ends, you may flip 1 of your Policy cards to its Enacted side.

cards.back_flavor: Jack always had a knack for getting people what they needed, and for a low enough price to raise eyebrows. As he moved from job to job, he found that he could help people who were in too deep, but only if he was willing to take on the burden himself. His debt grew with each person he saved, and so did the shadiness of his activities. Eventually, he found the police knocking on his door, so he fled into the depths of Arkham. These days, Jack can be found in dark alleys, making deals that the police could hardly imagine, to pay off his most recent debt.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-2. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 3 copies of Family Bonds, Prying Eyes, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: You didn't get that from me.
cards.name: Jack Myers
cards.text:
Handlocked.
[reaction] When you play the left most non-signature card in your hand: Reduce the cost of that card by 1 for every 3 other cards in your hand (limit once per round).
[elder_sign] effect: +1, if you succeed; draw a card and you may move a card in your hand up to 3 positions to the left or right.

cards.back_flavor: Akira Hojo lived with his father who worked as a doctor in a dangerously unstable country. When the chaos erupted, it took everything from him. He gathered together other suffering children to survive. With Chiaki Asami and few others, he fled the country. Only he and Chiaki managed to survive the journey. When he reached the safety of Arkham, he was met with by a dark, warped city. He decided he would reform the criminal underbelly of Arkham. He vowed to turn these gangsters into a force that could protect Arkham from the anything, be it man or monster.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-3, Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0. Neutral cards level 0-5. For every 8 experience you've earned in total, increase the level of Rogue cards you can take by 1 (max level 4) Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 Burning Ambition, 1 Occupational Hazard, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No Police cards.
cards.name: Akira Hojo
cards.text:
[reaction] When you initiate a [combat] test, spend 1 resource: Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 1 or more, gain 1 resource. If you succeed by 3 or more, gain 1 additional resource (limit once per round).
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If the resolution of this test defeats an enemy; gain 1 resource.

cards.back_flavor: The people around Alma always met gruesome fates. As an orphan, whenever she grew close to others, they suffered. As she got older, she realized she was the source of their misfortune---and their deaths. Distraught, she wandered into the depths of Arkham, where she found them: people who didn't care that she was a cursed existence, because they were already damned. She stood up for these kindred souls, who had been left for dead. Together, with new purpose, they would resist the fate forced upon them. She would stand vigil over the Damned as they rewrote their fate.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-3, Ally cards level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, and up to 10 other Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Vagrant Messenger, Inevitable Fate, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Alma Venandi
cards.text: Reduce the cost of the first non-unique Ally you play each round by 1. You have an additional ally slot that can only be used to hold non-unique allies. Other investigators at your location and connecting locations may use your Ally assets to: - Assign damage and/or horror. - If ready, use a [action], [free], or [reaction] ability as if they controlled it, then exhaust it. [elder_sign]: +1. You may heal 1 damage or 1 horror from an Ally asset at your location.

cards.back_flavor: During every age, terrors would try to invade the world. While most of humanity remained unaware, William was there, holding the final line between the world and the forces outside its understanding. From place to place, age to age, whenever the tides of madness began, he was there, waiting. Sometimes, he wonders if he holds back the chaos, or if his birth marks the start of the apocalypse.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Guardian ([guardian]) and Seeker ([seeker]) skill cards level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Lives Lessons, Cosmic Animosity, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "Another day, another world ending event."
cards.name: William Grindel
cards.text:
[reaction] After you commit a card to a skill test on a scenario card: The commited card gains [wild]. If this test is successful, draw 1 card. If another investigator succeeded this test by 2 or more, they draw 1 card. (Limit once per phase.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location.

cards.back_flavor: Elise, an traveler from England, fled the constraints of her bourgeois Parisian family to chase the world’s mysteries. With camera in hand and album full of wonders, she wandered from Cairo to Kolkata, chasing whispers ranging from the fanatical to the arcane. Her travels brought her to the foggy shores of Innsmouth, Massachusetts. Drawn by rumors of mysterious sightings and ancient ruins, Elise expected only photographs and ghost stories—until she found more than just rumors waiting for her. Her endless curiosity dissuades the cautious and attracts the dangerous as she ventures into the unknown.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Rogue and/or Survivor events ([rogue] and/or [survivor]) that say "investigate" or "discover" level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Photo Album, 3 copies of A Sight to See, A World Of Solitude, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Setup: You begin each game with 3 copies of A Sight to See set aside, out of play.
cards.flavor: "There is a whole world out there waiting to be discovered."
cards.name: Elise Collins
cards.text:
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness card from your deck, before resolving any of its effects, discard it: Add one of your set-aside A Sight to See events to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may discard 1 card from your hand, then draw 1 card.

cards.back_flavor:
At the Clover Club, Amelia pours drinks for the weary of Arkham. The gamblers, drifters, and lost souls come for whiskey and respite, but some bring whispers of things unseen.
As a child, she watched the sea writhe with shapes too vast to be real. Her father vanished there when they crossed the sea. Now, in the club’s dim glow, stories of such shapes creep into the sailors ramblings. And at night, she hears a voice off the horizon, whispering her name.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Spirit cards level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): "Drinks on me!", Alone in the World, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Amelia Barrett
cards.text: Investigators at your location can play event cards beneath Amelia Barrett as if they were in their hand, reducing its resource cost by 1. [reaction] After 1 or more damage/horror is assigned to player card your location and there are less than 3 cards beneath this card: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Spirit event and place it beneath this card. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] +1. You may shuffle a Spirit event from your discard into your deck.

cards.back_flavor: Growing up on the streets of Armenia, Armen Seropian was surrounded by risk at every turn. While others hesitated, he gambled everything just to see another tomorrow. However, when the Soviets invaded, even Armen recognized a risk too great to take and fled to America. There, he built a reputation as an unmatched gambler, eventually catching the attention of The Syndicate—a powerful, shadowy organization. Forced into what could have been the last game of his life, Armen narrowly won and escaped with his life. But his victory was short-lived. The Syndicate does not lose, and Armen could never truly be allowed to win. Now, he is a marked man, for no can be that lucky. Right?
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30 Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Neutral cards 0-5, events and/or skills that "gain resources" level 0-3. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): House Rules, Cheating Accusations, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor:
"All in." "Sir...You haven't looked
at your cards yet." "All in."
cards.name: Armen Seropian
cards.text:
Playing cards and triggering abilities that can cause you to gain resources ignore attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] When you gain at least 2 resources: Either... (Limit once per phase.)
-  Gain 1 resource.
-  Lose 1 resource and you get +2 skill value for the next test you perform this round. If you succeed, gain 2 resources.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. The next time you gain resources this round, increase the amount you gain by 1.

cards.back_flavor: For Wick, his wife was the only light in his life. After her mysterious death, he followed the bloody trail to the door of his own employer. The Syndicate's sudden betrayal was shocking-until Wick uncovers the truth. His wife’s death was no accident, but a failed ritual by a hidden cult festering within the Syndicate. Once their deadliest weapon, he's now their most hunted prey. The underworld turns against him, contracts placed on his head, allies vanish like smoke. Yet Wick moves through the shadows, a ghost of vengeance, hunting the traitors. Every step bringing him closer to where his revenge awaits, and madness whispers his name.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) 0-3, Firearm cards level 0-4, Tactic cards level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Marked for Death, Abandoned by God, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No Criminal Cards.
cards.name: John Wick
cards.text: [action] abilities that spend all remaining ammo on a Firearm asset you control deal +1 damage. [reaction] After you defeat an enemy without using an ability on a Firearm asset: Choose a Firearm asset in your discard pile. Either add it to your hand or play it. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign]: +1. After this test ends, you may replenish 1 use on a Firearm asset you control.

cards.back_flavor:
File #56–X
Subject Class: Yellow
Real Identity: Unknown 
Last Known Location: Arkham, Massachusetts
Description: Subject #56–X (hereinafter "John Smith") is a person of approximately 182.88cm in height. At all times, subject wears a traditional western suit and defective wristwatch. All other features vary by report, including perceived age, gender, and nationality.
Paradimensional Capabilities: John Smith changes their appearance over time, making tracking difficult. Reports of temporal distortions resulting in relocation of nearby personal. Subject avoids contact with the organization.
Approach Procedure: Exercise extreme caution regarding potential paradimensional disturbances.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30 Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards with "Encounter" and/or "Treachery" level 0-3. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Out of sight, 2 copies of Without a Trace, 2 copies of Fading Existence, Existential Overload, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Setup: You begin each game with 2 copies of Without a Trace and 2 copies of Fading Existence set aside, out of play.
cards.deck_requirements: size:30, card:40035, card:40036, card:40037, card:40038, random:subtype:basicweakness
cards.flavor:
"Who, them? They've been
here the whole time."
cards.name: John Smith
cards.text:
Reduce the difficulty of skill tests you perform while resolving revelation abilities on encounter cards by 1.
[reaction] When a player card causes you draw a non-weakness encounter card: Cancel all of that card's effects and place it on the bottom of the encounter deck. Then, draw another card from the top of the encounter deck. (Limit once per round).
[elder_sign]: +1. Place 1 resource on Out of Sight as a fragment.

cards.back_flavor: Across the underworld, Wick name is whispered in feared as the Syndicate's enforcer—taking lives across the globe. Orphaned as a child, he was raised by the Syndicate to kill without mercy. It's said he once silenced an entire gang in a single night. When his wife, the only light in his cursed life, died mysteriously, he found a trail of strange signs and eldritch horrors. Armed with years of deadly experiences, Wick hunts cultists, monsters, and cosmic horrors alike, following the trail to it's source.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) 0-3, Firearm cards level 0-4, Tactic cards level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Marked for Death, Abandoned by God, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No Blessed and/or Fortune cards.
cards.name: John Wick
cards.text: [reaction] When you play a Tactic or Trick event: Reduce it's cost by 1. Then, you may resolve a [action] on a Firearm asset you control. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign]: +1. If you succeed by 2 or more, ready a Weapon you control. If you succeed by 4 or more, draw 1 card.

cards.back_flavor: From boyhood, Elijah Simmons dreamed in impossible colors—of lost cities, whispering gods, and skies that bent the stars. His tales made others laugh, but he always knew they were more than dreams. In retirement, drawn to quiet Kingsport, sleep became stranger still. Now he meets other Elijahs—older, broken, waiting. They wear different faces, but speak with one voice: “Stop what’s coming, or you’ll join us. Another echo in the dream.” Haunted and unsure, Elijah wakes each night with their warning. With the wisdom of a thousand voices, he must tell his own story.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30 Trait Choice: At deck creation, choose up to 2: Insight, Spell, or Trick. If you choose 2, gain +5 Deck Size. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards, and up to 15 other events of your chosen trait(s) 0-3. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 [per_investigator] copies of The Best of Times, The Worst of Times, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: You begin each game with 1 [per_investigator] copies of The Best of Times set aside, out of play. When the first investigation phase of the game begins: Shuffle 1 copy of The Best of Times into each players deck. They are considered the owner of the card for the scenario.

option_select.name: Insight
option_select.error: You cannot have more than 15 Insight cards that are not Survivor or Neutral

option_select.name: Spell
option_select.error: You cannot have more than 15 Spell cards that are not Survivor or Neutral

option_select.name: Trick
option_select.error: You cannot have more than 15 Trick cards that are not Survivor or Neutral

option_select.name: Insight and Spell
option_select.error: You cannot have more than 15 Insight and Spell cards that are not Survivor or Neutral

option_select.name: Insight and Trick
option_select.error: You cannot have more than 15 Insight and Trick cards that are not Survivor or Neutral

option_select.name: Spell and Trick
option_select.error: You cannot have more than 15 Spell and Trick cards that are not Survivor or Neutral

cards.flavor: "Now this takes me back."
cards.name: "Old Man" Simmons
cards.text: Your event cards that Fight, Investigate, or Evade gain Parley while there is an enemy at your location. [free] While performing a skill test on an event card: Commit a skill from the discard pile of an investigator who resolved an event this round. After this test ends, shuffle the chosen skill into the owners deck. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +1. After this test ends, you may return a skill card you committed to this skill test to it's owners hand (do not shuffle it into their deck).

cards.name: Push for Progress
cards.text: Chiaki Asami deck only. Fast. Play only during your turn. Max twice per round. Flip 1 your policy cards to its Pending side, then ready it. You may spend 1 resource. Flip 1 of your policy cards to its Enacted side (2 if you spent a resource this way).

cards.name: On Borrowed Time
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced At the end of your turn: Take X damage, where X is the number of actions you spent this round. If another investigator is at your location, take 1 direct horror. Discard On Borrowed Time.

cards.flavor: "Favors bought in blood and loyalty."
cards.name: Family Bonds
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn. Max twice per round. Jack Myer Deck only.
Family Bonds does not count towards your maximum hand size.
Move a non-weakness card in your hand up to 2 positions to the left or right. Draw a card. Shuffle this card into your deck.

cards.name: Prying Eyes
cards.text: Prying Eyes cannot be discarded. While Prying Eyes is in your hand: You can only play the 2 leftmost cards in your hand. (Prying Eyes cannot be discarded.) Forced At the end of your turn: move Prying Eyes one position to the left.

cards.flavor:
"Why did you become a gangster?"
"Because you can do in a single day..."
cards.name: Burning Ambition
cards.text: Akira Hojo deck only. Fast. Uses (0 clout). [reaction] After you succeed a test by 3 or more while using Akira Hojo's [reaction] ability, place 1 clout on Burning Ambition. Forced When there are at least 3 clout on Burning Ambition: Search your bonded cards for Rite of Passage and swap it with Burning Ambition.

cards.flavor: "...What it takes an ordinary man thirty years to do."
cards.name: Rite of Passage
cards.text: Bonded (Burning Ambition). This card cannot leave play. You get +1 [agility]. [reaction] After you succeed a skill test by 3 or more, exhaust Rite of Passage: Play an event card from your hand (paying its cost).

cards.name: Occupational Hazard
cards.text: Revelation Put Occupational Hazard into play in your threat area. Forced At the end of your turn take 1 damage. If an ally is defeated this way, take 1 horror and discard Occupational Hazard.

cards.flavor: "While the city quietly left us to die, she kept us going. We will do our part to end this damnation."
cards.name: Vagrant Messenger
cards.text:
Alma Venandi deck only.
Enemies at your location have -1 evade.
[free] Exhaust Vagrant Messenger and deal 1 damage to it: Move to Alma Venandi's location.

cards.flavor: "Not again! I'm sorry. I'm so sorry."
cards.name: Inevitable Fate
cards.text: Revelation Place Inevitable Fate into play in your threat area. It costs investigators an additional action to leave your location. [action] Discard an Ally asset controlled by Alma Venandi: Discard Inevitable Fate. Any investigator may activate this ability.

cards.name: Lives Lessons
cards.text:
William Grindel's deck only. Fast. Play when an investigator reveals a chaos token that would make them fail a skill test on an scenario card.
Cancel all revealed chaos tokens and reveal a new chaos token. The performing investigator may set their base skill value equal to your [willpower] value for the remainder of this test.

cards.name: Cosmic Animosity
cards.text: Revelation Put Cosmic Animosity into play in your threat area. The first non-weakness treachery card you draw each round gains surge. [reaction] After you fail a skill test on a scenario card: Discard Cosmic Animosity.

cards.name: A Sight to See
cards.text: Investigate. You get +1 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, discover a clue at a connecting location. Forced When A Sight to See would be discarded: Set it aside, out of play, instead.

cards.name: Photo Album
cards.text:
Elise Collnis deck only. Uses (2 secrets).
[reaction] After you succeed the test on a copy of A Sight to See, place 1 secret on Photo Album.
[free] Spend 2 secrets and exhaust Photo Album: Shuffle 1 event from your discard into your deck.

cards.name: A World Of Solitude
cards.text: Revelation Put this card into play in your threat area. You cannot play events unless you have taken a move action this round. [action] Discard 2 copies of A Sight to See: Discard A World Of Solitude

cards.name: <"Drinks on me!"
cards.text: Amelia Barrett deck only. For the remainder of the round, healing from player card effects may be disturbed among investigators and/or Ally assets at their location. Heal 2 damage and 2 horror. You may take 1 horror, then draw 1 card.

cards.name: Alone in the World
cards.text: Revelation For each Spirit event in your hand, either take 1 horror or discard it. Then, if you have no Spirit events in hand, discard the top 5 cards of your deck. Draw each weaknesses discarded this way.

cards.name: Policy
cards.text: Permanent. Chiaki Asami deck only. [reaction] When you would discover 1 or more clues at your location, exhaust this card: Another investigator discovers that many clues at their location instead. [free] During your turn, if you played a Insight event this round, exhaust this card: Take an Investigate action.

cards.name: Policy
cards.text: Permanent. Chiaki Asami deck only. [reaction] When an investigator at your location would play an Insight or Favor card, exhaust this card: It gains fast. [free] During your turn, exhaust this card: Draw 1 card.

cards.name: Policy
cards.text:
Permanent. Chiaki Asami deck only.
[reaction] When you play an event, exhaust this card: Another investigator at your location gains resources equal to half the cost of the event (minimum 1, rounded up).
[free] During your turn, exhaust this card: Reduce the cost of the next card you play this turn by 1.

cards.name: House Rules
cards.text: Armen Seropian's deck only. Investigate. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed, either gain 3 resources or discover 1 additional clue at this location (if you succeed by 3 or more, do both).

cards.name: Cheating Accusations
cards.text: Revelation Discard 3 resources. Draw 1 card. If you have at least 10 resources remaining in your resource pool and there are at least 5 cards remaining in your deck, shuffle Cheating Accusations into your deck.

cards.name: Marked for Death
cards.text:
John Wick deck only.
Fast. Choose an enemy at your location. Attach Marked for Death to it and engage it. 
You get +2 skill value during tests while fighting the attached enemy.
[reaction] After the attached enemy is defeated: Heal 1 damage and horror (2 if the enemy had at least 4 printed health).

cards.name: Abandoned by God
cards.text: Revelation Put Abandoned by God into play in your threat area. Cards in your play area and discard pile lose the Firearm and Weapon traits. [action] [action]: Discard Abandoned by God. Reduce this ability's action cost by 1 if John Wick was healed this round.

cards.name: Out of Sight
cards.text: John Smith deck only. Permanent. Uses (1 fragment). [reaction] After you resolve an encounter card: Place 1 fragment on Out of Sight. [free] Spend 2 fragments and exhaust Out of Sight: Shuffle one of you set-aside [REDACTED] cards into the top 8 cards of the encounter deck. Forced When a [REDACTED] card you own would be discarded from anywhere: Set it aside, out of play, instead.

cards.name: Fading Existence
cards.text: Hunter. Surge. You may place a non-weakness, non-Elite enemy at any location on the bottom of the encounter deck and spawn Fading Existence at that location. Otherwise, discard Fading Existence. When Fading Existence would be discarded: John Smith discovers 1 clue at John Smith's location.

cards.name: Without a Trace
cards.text: Surge. Revelation Choose and resolve up to 2 of the following, in any order: - Choose and discard from play a non-weakness treachery that is not attached to an Elite enemy. - Heal 1 damage or 1 horror. - Move to John Smith's Location.

cards.name: Existential Overload
cards.text: Revelation Put Existential Overload into play in your threat area, with 3 rifts on it. If there are no rifts on Existential Overload discard it. Forced After an investigator draws an encounter card due to surge, remove 1 rift from this card: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: The Best of Times
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, the owner of this card draws 1 card.

cards.name: The Worst of Times
cards.text: Revelation Put The Worst of Times into play in your threat area. Cards you commit lose 1 matching icon and all effects. Forced After you succeed a skill test during your turn, if you commited at least 2 skills, discard The Worst of Times. Otherwise take 1 horror and shuffle The Worst of Times into your deck.

cards.name: Assemble the Team
cards.text: Fast. Play only during your turn. Attach to an Agency, Police, or Hunter asset you control that takes up at least 1 ally slot. Attached asset takes up 1 fewer ally slot.

cards.name: Beseeching Prayer
cards.text:
[reaction] After a skill test ends, during which the original [elder_sign] token was resolved and this card is ready: Seal ([elder_sign]).
[reaction] When a chaos token would be revealed from the chaos bag during a skill test at your location, exhaust Beseeching Prayer: Resolve the token sealed here, as if it were just revealed from the chaos bag. Then reveal another token.

cards.name: Discarded Dog Tags
cards.text: [reaction] After an investigator at your location takes damage, exhaust Discarded Dog Tags and deal it 1 damage: Gain 1 resource and heal 1 horror.

cards.name: Close Quarters
cards.text: Fight. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this attack and you may take 1 damage. If you succeed, this attack deals +1 damage (+2 if you took damage while resolving this card.)

cards.name: Distribute Supplies
cards.text: As an additional cost to play Distribute Supplies, choose and discard an Item asset from your hand or play area. Investigators at your location gain a total of X resources, distributed as you wish, where X is the printed cost of the discarded asset plus 1 (Max 5 resources).

cards.name: Good Cap, Bad Cop
cards.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [combat] (3) or [intellect] (3). If you succeed discover 1 clue at your location and if that enemy... - is Humanoid, discover 1 additional clue. - is not Humanoid, deal that enemy 1 damage; if they are non-Elite, exhaust them.

cards.name: Absolute Focus
cards.text: You get +1 to each of your skills during this skill test.

cards.name: Insult
cards.text: Fast. Play during any [free] player window. Choose a non-Elite enemy at your location with damage on it. Attach Insult to that enemy and move 1 damage on it to this card. [reaction] After the attached enemy is defeated: Draw 1 card and gain 2 resources.

cards.name: Lie in Wait
cards.text: [free] During the enemy phase, spend 1 action: Take a Fight or Engage action as if it was your turn (this can provoke attacks of opportunity).

cards.name: Rush to the scene
cards.text: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] Before you draw your opening hand, spend 2 resources: Search your deck for a Firearm asset with Uses (X ammo) and takes up only 1 hand slot. Put it into play with 1 ammo on it. Shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Good Cap, Bad Cop
cards.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [combat] (2) or [intellect] (2). If you succeed discover 1 clue at your location and if that enemy... - is Humanoid, discover 1 additional clue. - is not Humanoid, deal that enemy 1 damage and exhaust them.

cards.name: "I'm too old for this..."
cards.text: If this test is successful, heal 1 horror and draw 1 card. If you fail, heal 2 horror instead.

cards.name: Security Guard
cards.text: Uses (1 Supply). You get +1 [combat] and +1 [agility]. [reaction] After you perform a fight action, exhaust Security Guard: Place 1 supply on Security Guard. [free] Spend 3 supplies: Automatically evade a non-Elite enemy at your location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: "This ends now!"
cards.name: Hunt them Down
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn. Max once per round.
You may take an additional 4 actions this turn. At the beginning of next round, you lose 3 - X actions, where X is the number of remaining actions you had last round (minimum 0).

cards.name: Insult
cards.text: Fast. Play during any [free] player window. Choose a non-Elite enemy at your location with damage on it. Attach Insult to that enemy and move up to 2 damage on it to this card. [reaction] When the attached enemy attacks Insult's owner: Reduce the amount of horror dealt by 1. [reaction] After the attached enemy is defeated: Draw 2 cards. Gain 2 resources for each damage on Insult.

cards.name: "I'm Gonna Need a Bigger Gun."
cards.text: If you succeed, move all the ammo from that Firearm to this card. Discard that card and play a Firearm asset from you hand, reducing its cost by the cost of the card you discarded. Move all ammo from this card to the played Firearm.

cards.name: Dave Reacher
cards.text:
While at least half of the cards in your hand are events: You get +1 [intellect]. Otherwise, you get +1 [willpower].
[free] During your turn, exhaust Dave Reacher: Discard 1 card, then draw 1 card.

cards.name: Bloody Lab Coat
cards.text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
[reaction] When you would commit a non-skill card, exhaust Bloody Lab Coat: That card gains a non-[wild] icon it did not already have.

cards.name: "Do as I do."
cards.text:
Play only after you succeed a skill test during your turn.
Choose another investigator at your location. They take an action with the same type as your last action. If they succeed a skill test, one of you gain 3 resources. If they fail a skill test, you may take an additional action this turn.

cards.name: Eldritch Research
cards.text: Take 1 horror. Discard the top 6 cards of your deck. Add up to 2 cards discarded this way to your hand. Shuffle each weakness discarded by this effect back into your deck.

cards.name: Following the Trail
cards.text: Investigate. You may move to a connecting location. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this investigation..

cards.name: Glint From Afar
cards.text: Choose an investigator at your location. Move that investigator to a connecting location. Repeat this text for every 2 locations that were unrevealed when you played Glint From Afar. (Limit 3 total moves.)

cards.name: Rampant Search
cards.text: Investigate. Add your [combat] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed, discard 1 card from you hand and draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Snooping Around
cards.text:
Fast. Play only at the end of the mythos phase.
Search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck for an enemy and spawn it engaged with you. Attach Snooping Around to it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
[reaction] When an investigator defeats the attached enemy: They discover 1 clue at their location. You or that investigator heal 2 horror.

cards.name: Mysterious Scriptures
cards.text: Investigate. You get +1 [intellect] for this investigation (+3 [intellect] if you have 2 or more Insight cards in your hand). If you succeed, after this test ends you may play an event from your hand other than Mysterious Scriptures, reducing its cost by 2.

cards.flavor: "Just beat them at their own game."
cards.name: Outmaneuver
cards.text: Parley. Choose a non-Elite enemy at your location. Test [intellect] (X), where X is your location's shroud value. If you succeed, move that enemy to a connecting location. You may move up to 2 clues from your location to that location or visa-versa.

cards.name: Seeing the Big Picture
cards.text:
Exceptional.
Commit only to a skill test you are performing. If this skill test is successful and was on initiated by an event card, return this card to your hand. If that event has the same name as a card in your discard pile, gain 1 resource.

cards.name: Heather Freeman
cards.text:
You get +1 [intellect].
While you have 5 or more cards in your hand, you get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After you discard at least 1 card from your hand or deck, exhaust Heather Freeman: Draw 1 card. You may discard the card you drew, then draw 1 card.

cards.name: Shroud of the Old Ones
cards.text: [reaction] When a non-Elite enemy would spawn at your location, exhaust Shroud of the Old Ones and choose a connecting location that is unrevealed or has least 1 clue on it: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, move to the chosen location, if able.

cards.name: Recursion
cards.text: [reaction] After you play an event during your turn, exhaust Recursion: Place that card on the bottom of your deck and draw 1 card. If the drawn card shares a trait with the played card, you may play it (paying it's cost).

cards.name: Bookkeeping
cards.text:
If in your discard, there are at least...
- ...10 cards, discover 1 clue at your location.
- ...15 cards, discover 2 clues at any location.
Shuffle your discard into your deck.

cards.flavor: "It will consume everything you are."
cards.name: Tome of the Forgotten
cards.text: You get +2 skill value while resolving skill tests on event cards. [reaction] At the start of your turn, add an Insight card from your discard to your hand. At the end of your turn, remove that card from the game.

cards.name: Inner Lining
cards.text: Uses (3 supplies). [reaction] After you play an Illicit card, spend 1 supply and exhaust Inner Lining: Place 1 supply or ammo on another asset you control.

cards.name: Oddly Shaped Key
cards.text: Fast. Limit 1 per deck. [action] If Oddly Shaped Key is in your play area: Investigate. If a +1, +0, or [elder_sign] token is revealed during this test, attach Oddly Shaped Key to your location. Otherwise, return this card to your hand. (Max 1 test per location) [action]: If Oddly Shaped Key is attached to your location, discover 1 clue from that location.

cards.name: Stacked Deck
cards.text:
Uses (4 supplies). Limit 15 supplies on Stacked Deck.
[reaction] After you play a card: Place 1 supply on this card.
[action] Discard Stacked Deck: Move all supplies from it to your resource pool, as resources.

cards.name: Discarded Evidence
cards.text:
After playing Discarded Evidence, if you have an odd number of cards in your hand gain 2 resources and draw 1 card.
Otherwise, gain 3 resources. You may discard 1 card, then draw 1 card.

cards.name: "Let Me See That!"
cards.text: Use a [action] ability on an Item asset controlled by another investigator at your location, as if that asset was under your control. If you succeed a skill test during that ability, you and the owner of that asset gain 1 resource. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: The First to Flinch
cards.text: Group limit 1 The First to Flinch in play. Fast. Play after an investigator at your location draws a non-peril encounter card, but before resolving that card's effects. Put The First to Flinch into play in your play area and attach that treachery to it instead of resolving it. Forced At the start of the mythos phase, an investigator draws the attached card. Then, discard The First to Flinch.

cards.name: Unstable Terrain
cards.text: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evade. If you succeed, you deal the evaded enemy 1 damage (2 damage instead if you succeed by 2 or more).

cards.name: "Who's counting?"
cards.text: Fight. Perform a Fight action using a Weapon asset you control with no ammo remaining, as if it had 1 ammo. The attacked enemy gains retaliate for the duration of this skill test. If you succeed, place 1 ammo on the Weapon asset used.

cards.name: Working the Angles
cards.text: While your base [agility] value is greater than the shroud value of your location, Working the Angles gains [willpower] and the text "If this test is successful, draw 1 card."

cards.name: Flawless Execution
cards.text:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.	
If this test was on an event card and is successful: Gain X resources, where X is the cost of the event card when you played it.

cards.name: The Klabb
cards.text: Uses (4 ammo). While you control at least 2 Illicit assets, The Klabb gains fast. It enters play with 1 additional ammo for each other Illicit card you control (limit 3 additional ammo). [reaction] If you would succeed a skill test while fighting, you may spend 1 ammo to increase your skill value by 2. (Limit once per test.) [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this attack and you deal +1 damage.

cards.name: Platinum Club
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack for every 4 resources in your resource pool (Limit +5 [combat]). As an additional cost to initiate this ability, you may exhaust Platinum Club. If you do, you deal +1 damage for this attack.

cards.name: Stacked Deck
cards.text:
Uses (6 supplies). Limit 20 supplies on Stacked Deck.
[reaction] After you play a card: Place 1 resource on this card.
[free] Discard Stacked Deck: Move all supplies from it to your resource pool, as resources.

cards.name: End of the Line
cards.text: Fight. This attack deals +1 damage. If playing End of the Line cost less than... - ...3 resources, Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this attack. - ...1 resources, this attack deals an additional +2 damage.

cards.flavor: "Wait a second..!"
cards.name: Five of a Kind
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose one of the following cardtypes (asset, event, or skill). Reveal each card of that type from your hand. If you revealed at least...
...3 cards, draw 2 cards.
...4 cards, gain 2 resources.
...5 cards, you may take an additional 2 actions this turn. 
Remove Five of a Kind from the game.

cards.name: The Couriers
cards.text:
Uses (3 resources).
As an addition cost to take an action, you may spend at least 1 resource from The Couriers. Reduce the cost of cards played this way by that many resources. You may take that action as if you were at connecting location.
[reaction] When you play a card with 0 cost, exhaust The Couriers: Place 1 resource on The Couriers and that card gains fast.

cards.name: Celestial Inscriptions
cards.text: [reaction] When when you would succeed a skill test, exhaust Celestial Inscriptions: You get +2 skill value for this skill test. Reveal another token.

cards.name: Rending
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). If Rending has no charges, discard it or spend 1 resource to shuffle it into your deck. [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat] and deals +1 damage. If you fail, shuffle 1 non-weakness event from your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Trace Scrying
cards.text: Uses (2 charges). If Trace Scrying has no charges, discard it or spend 1 resource to shuffle it into your deck. [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If you fail, shuffle 1 non-weakness asset from your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Flickering Memories
cards.text: Investigate. Reduce the cost to play Flickering Memories by 1 or add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed, you discover 1 additional clue at your location. If you succeeded, Flickering Memories cost less than 2 resource to play, and you used your [willpower] value in the skill test, you may shuffle Flickering Memories into your deck.

cards.name: Recreation
cards.text: Choose a card in your hand. Search the top 9 cards of your deck for up to 2 cards that share at least 1 trait with the chosen card, and draw them. Shuffle the chosen card into your deck.

cards.name: Shockwave
cards.text: Fight. Reduce the cost to play Shockwave by 1 or add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed, this attack deals +1 damage (+2 damage instead if the enemy is non-Elite). If you succeeded, Shockwave cost less than 2 resource to play, and you used your [willpower] value in the skill test, you may shuffle Shockwave into your deck.

cards.name: Old Ideas, New Methods
cards.text: If this skill test is successful, add Old Ideas, New Methods to your play area as an asset with the text: "You get +1 [willpower]. Forced At the start of the investigation phase: Discard Old Ideas, New Methods."

cards.name: Infuse Strength
cards.text:
Uses (3 Charges). If this card has no charges, discard it.
For the purpose of counting icons committed to your skill tests, [willpower] icons on your cards count as matching icons.
[reaction] When you initiate a skill test on an event card that does not use or add your [willpower], exhaust Infuse Strength: Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this test. If you fail, remove 1 charge from Infuse Strength.

cards.flavor: "We can't run forever, but we can try."
cards.name: Rewrite Fate
cards.text: Fast. Play only during your turn. Uses (3 charges). Attach to an Ally asset you control. Attached asset gets +1 health. [free] Spend 1 charge and exhaust Rewrite Fate: Shuffle a player card in your hand into your deck. Draw 1 card.

cards.name: Bend Reality
cards.text:
Myriad. Fast. Play only during your turn.
Attach to your location or a connecting location. Group limit 3 in play. 
[free] Move an investigator at your location to a location with a Bend Reality attached to it. Discard this card or spend 1 resource to shuffle Bend Reality into your deck.

cards.name: Blessing From Beyond
cards.text: Commit only to a skill test you are performing. Max 1 committed per skill test. If multiple chaos tokens are resolved during this skill test, you may return Blessing From Beyond to your hand after this test ends. (Canceled and ignored tokens are not resolved.)

cards.name: Shackles of the Deep
cards.text: Exceptional. While there is only 1 non-Elite enemy engaged with you, they cannot make attacks of opportunity. While you have at least 4 [combat] and 4 [willpower], the ability below gains: "You deal +2 damage for this attack." [action] Fight. For this attack you may use your [willpower] instead of [combat], and you get +3 skill value for this attack.

cards.name: Dale Briggs
cards.text: You get +1 [intellect]. [reaction] After a Spell or Ritual asset you control leaves play, exhaust Dale Briggs: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a Spell or Ritual card. Draw it or play it (paying it cost). Shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Rending
cards.text: Uses (4 charges). If Rending has no charges, discard it or shuffle it into your deck. [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +3 [willpower] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you fail, shuffle 1 non-weakness event from your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Trace Scrying
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). If Trace Scrying has no charges, discard it or shuffle it into your deck. [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. You get +3 [willpower] for this test. If you succeed you discover 1 additional clue at this location. If you fail, shuffle 1 non-weakness asset from your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Hand Wrap
cards.text: Limit 1 per investigator. Uses (3 grit). You get +1 [combat] during basic fight actions. [reaction] After you defeat an enemy that you dealt at least 1 damage to with a basic fight action this round, spend 1 grit and exhaust Hand Wrap: Choose a level 0-1 Innate skill in your discard pile. Add the chosen skill to your hand.

cards.name: Lucky Rabbit
cards.text: [free] Discard Lucky Rabbit: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator searches the top 9 cards of his or her deck for a Item card, draws it, and shuffles his or her deck.

cards.flavor: "Someone's gotta keep this city from falling apart."
cards.name: Maintenance Worker
cards.text: [reaction] After your turn begins, choose and discard 1 card from your hand and exhaust Maintenance Worker: Gain 1 resource.

cards.name: Work Boots
cards.text: Limit 1 Footwear per investigator. When an investigator at your location draws a non-peril Hazard treachery, you may draw it instead. [reaction] When you would be dealt damage and/or horror by a Hazard treachery, exhaust Work Boots: Reduced the damage or horror dealt by 1.

cards.name: Mysteries of the Forest
cards.text: Investigate. You get +1 [intellect] during this skill test for each Creature card in your control and/or discard pile. If you succeed and have at least 3 total Creature cards in your control and/or discard, you discover 1 additional clue at your location.

cards.name: Soul Searching
cards.text: Investigate. This investigation uses your skill with the lowest base value, instead of [intellect]. Add the value of your skill with the second lowest base value to your skill value for this test. If you succeed, you may heal 1 damage or 1 horror.

cards.name: Jumpy
cards.text: You can only commit Jumpy to a basic evade action. If you succeed, add Jumpy to your play area as an asset with the text (limit 1 per round): You get +1 [agility]. Forced At the start of the investigation phase: Shuffle Jumpy into your deck.

cards.name: Nosy
cards.text: You can only commit Nosy to a basic investigate action. If you succeed, add Nosy to your play area as an asset with the text (limit 1 per round): You get +1 [intellect]. Forced At the start of the investigation phase: Shuffle Nosy into your deck.

cards.name: Touchy
cards.text: You can only commit Touchy to a basic fight action. If you succeed, add Touchy to your play area as an asset with the text (limit 1 per round): You get +1 [combat]. Forced At the start of the investigation phase: Shuffle Touchy into your deck.

cards.name: Survival Skills
cards.text:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
While Survival Skills is committed to a skill test, you get +2 to one of your skills with the lowest base value.

cards.flavor: "Someone's gotta keep this city from falling apart."
cards.name: Maintenance Worker
cards.text: [reaction] After your turn begins, choose and discard up to 2 cards from your hand and exhaust Maintenance Worker: Gain 1 resource. If you discarded 2 cards this way, draw 1 card.

cards.name: Follow Through
cards.text:
Fast. Play when you would fail a skill test by 3 or less while performing a basic fight or evade action.
You ignore retaliate and alert during this test. Then take a fight action, targeting the same enemy. You get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.

cards.name: Hand Wrap
cards.text: Limit 1 per investigator. Uses (4 grit). You get +2 [combat] during basic fight actions. [reaction] After you defeat an enemy that you dealt at least 1 damage to with a basic fight action this round, spend 1 grit and exhaust Hand Wrap: Choose an Innate skill in your discard pile. Add the chosen skill to your hand.

cards.name: Jumpy
cards.text: You can only commit Jumpy to a basic evade action. If you succeed, add Jumpy to your play area as an asset with the text (limit 1 per round): You get +1 [agility]. You may take an additional evade or move action during your turn. Forced At the start of the investigation phase: Shuffle Jumpy into your deck.

cards.name: Nosy
cards.text: You can only commit Nosy to a basic investigate action. If you succeed, add Nosy to your play area as an asset with the text (limit 1 per round): You get +1 [intellect]. You may take an additional investigate action during your turn. Forced At the start of the investigation phase: Shuffle Nosy into your deck.

cards.name: Touchy
cards.text: You can only commit Touchy to a basic fight action. If you succeed, add Touchy to your play area as an asset with the text (limit 1 per round): You get +1 [combat]. You may take an additional fight action during your turn. Forced At the start of the investigation phase: Shuffle Touchy into your deck.

cards.name: Goal Oriented
cards.text: If this skill test is successful, after this test resolves... - If the performing investigator discovered clues, they deal 1 additional damage. - If the performing investigator dealt damage, they may discover 1 additional clue. (Additional requires you to have already discovered clues/dealt damage during this test.)

cards.name: Shattered Timepiece
cards.text: Exceptional. Uses (2 charges). [reaction] After a Non-Elite enemy enters your location, exhaust Shattered Timepiece and you may spend 1 charge: If you spent a charge this way, that enemy enters your location exhausted. Otherwise place 1 charge on Shattered Timepiece. [free] Spend 1 charge: Choose an investigator at your location. Move them to a connecting location.

cards.name: Look to the Stars
cards.text: Fast. Play when an investigator would fail a skill test. That investigator gets +3 skill value for this test (+5 if it was a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] token). Reveal another token. If this skill test succeeds, draw 1 card.

cards.flavor: "Who am I? What am I?"
cards.name: Mask of the Forgotten
cards.text: Limit 1 Mask in play. [reaction] When you target an enemy with a player card effect or ability: That enemy gains the Monster and Humanoid traits, if they didn't already have them, for the duration of the effect or ability.

cards.name: Ring of Desire
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] After Ring of Desire enters play and after your turn begins, choose one of you skills: If that skill has a lower base value than at least one other skill, increase it's base value by 1 until the start of your next turn. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: "I'm sure we can handle this."
cards.name: Calm the Nerves
cards.text:
If there is a copy of Calm the Nerves in your discard, this card gains [wild] [wild].
Choose an investigator at your location. They heal 1 horror (2 if a copy of Calm the Nerves is in your discard pile.)

cards.name: Life Experience
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Life Experience to any type of test.</width>
You get +1 to each of your skills for this skill test. 
If this test is successful and a second skill's value was added the your skill value this test: Draw 1 card.

cards.name: Circlet of Sealing
cards.text: During the enemy phase, enemies at your location have -1 fight and -1 evade.

cards.name: Essence of Humanity
cards.text:
Permanent.
This card can only be purchased by 1 investigator once per campaign.
When the owner of this card would take any amount of trauma, cancel 1 of it and exile Essence of Humanity.

cards.flavor: "I can feel them crawling under my skin!"
cards.name: Delusional Parasitosis
cards.text: Revelation Place Delusional Parasitosis into play in your threat area. Forced At the end of your turn: If there are no other investigators at your location, take 1 damage. Otherwise take 1 horror. [action] [action]: Discard Delusional Parasitosis.

cards.name: Overshadowed
cards.text: Revelation Place Overshadowed into play in your threat area. Forced At the end of your turn: If an enemy is at your location, take 1 damage. Otherwise take 1 horror. [action] [action]: Discard Overshadowed.

cards.name: Sword of the Last Crusader
cards.text: Increase the [elder_sign] token's modifier by +1. [action] Fight. For this attack, you may use [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 skill value for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. [free] If an [elder_sign] token was revealed this round, exhaust this card: Perform the above fight action, ignoring it's [action] cost.

cards.name: Leyline Reading
cards.text: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion. If you succeed, Add Leyline Reading to your play area as an asset with the text: Limit 1 per investigator. [free]: Shuffle Leyline Reading into your deck. Reduce the cost of the next Spell card you play this turn by 2.

cards.name: Woodland Axe
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If your last action you performed this turn was a basic fight or evade action, this attack deals +1 damage.

cards.name: Down to Earth
cards.text: Limit 1 per investigator. [reaction] After you succeed a skill test during a basic action that you committed at least 1 skill to, exhaust Down to Earth: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for an Innate skill and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

cards.name: The Final Flame
cards.text:
[reaction] When you play a card, exhaust The Final Flame or shuffle it into your deck: Reduce the cards cost by 1 (If you shuffled The Final Flame, into your deck, reduce the cost by 3 instead).
[reaction] After you shuffle at least 1 card from your hand, play area, or limbo into your deck: Put The Final Flame into play from your hand.

cards.name: Breaking your Limits
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn. (Max 1 per round.)
Take 2 direct damage and horror. Until the end of the round, set the base value of your [combat] and [agility] to 6. You may take an additional action this turn for every 3 damage and/or horror on your investigator card. Remove this card from the game.

cards.flavor: "It's time to take it back."
cards.name: Repossession Contract
cards.text: Limit 1 per deck. Forced After Repossession Contract enter play: Search your bonded cards for Prowler and put it into play. When Repossession Contract leaves play, remove Prowler and Shadowfoot from the game (even if they are out of play).

cards.name: Prowler
cards.text: Bonded (Repossession Contract). Uses (0 loot). [reaction] After you succeed an investigation by 1 or more: Place 1 loot on Prowler. Forced After you investigate, if 2 loot are on Prowler: Move all loot on this card to your resource pool, as resources. Search your bonded cards for Shadowfoot and put it into play. Remove Prowler from the game.

cards.name: Shadowfoot
cards.text: Bonded (Repossession Contract). Uses (0 loot). [reaction] After you succeed an investigation by 2 or more: Place 1 loot on Shadowfoot. Forced After you investigate, if 4 loot are on Shadowfoot: Move all loot on this card to your resource pool, as resources. Search your bonded cards for Master Thief and put it into play. Remove Shadowfoot from the game.

cards.name: Master Thief
cards.text:
Bonded (Repossession Contract). Uses (0 loot). Master Thief cannot leave play.
You get +1 skill value while investigating and evading.
[reaction] After you succeed an investigation by 3 or more, exhaust Master Thief: Draw 1 card and place 1 loot on Master Thief. Then, if there are least 2 loot on Master Thief, you may move all loot on this card to your resource pool, as resources.

cards.name: Cautious
cards.text:
Fast. You may play or commit the card attached to Cautious as if it were in your hand.
[free] If there is not a card attached to Cautious, exhaust Cautious: Attach 1 non-weakness player card from your hand to Cautious.

cards.name: Undercover Agent
cards.text:
Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] After Undercover Agent enters play: You get +2 [combat] until the end of the round.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy with at least 3 health, discard Undercover Agent: Discover 1 clue at your location.

cards.name: Back Alley Surgeon
cards.text: Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity. [reaction] After Back Alley Surgeon enters play: You get +2 [intellect] until the end of the round. [reaction] After your turn begins or ends, discard Back Alley Surgeon: Heal 1 damage or horror from an investigator or Ally asset at your location.

cards.name: Underworld Assassin
cards.text:
Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] After Underworld Assassin enters play: You get
 +2 [agility] until the end of the round.
[reaction] After your turn begins or ends, discard Underworld Assassin: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.

cards.name: Wayward Pilgrim
cards.text:
Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] After Wayward Pilgrim enters play: You get +2 [willpower] until the end of the round.
[reaction] After your turn begins or ends, discard Wayward Pilgrim: Place 1 charge on an asset you control.

cards.name: Ship Captain
cards.text:
Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] After Ship Captain enters play: Move to a connecting location.
[reaction] After your turn begins or ends, discard Ship Captain: Move an investigator at a connecting location to your location.

cards.name: Agent of the Order
cards.text:
You get +1 [combat].
[reaction] When you play Agent of the Order, if an enemy at your location has exactly 1 remaining health: Deal 1 damage to that enemy and Agent of the Order gains fast.
[reaction] After you fail an attack by 2 or less, exhaust Agent of the Order: You get +1 [agility] this round. You may take an evade action.

cards.flavor:
"Even people like us can make a 
difference if we put of life on the line."
cards.name: The Damned
cards.text:
[reaction] When an investigator at your location initiates a skill test, deal 1 damage or horror to The Damned: Reduce the difficulty of that test by 2.
[reaction] After your turn ends, exhaust The Damned: Heal 1 damage or horror from The Damned.

cards.name: Woodland Axe
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If your last action you performed this turn was a basic fight or evade action, this attack deals +1 damage. If you fail, you may exhaust Woodland Axe, then take a basic action.

cards.name: Rending
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). If Rending has no charges, discard it or spend 1 resource to shuffle it into your deck. [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you fail, shuffle 1 non-weakness event from your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Trace Scrying
cards.text: Uses (2 charges). If Trace Scrying has no charges, discard it or spend 1 resource to shuffle it into your deck. [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect].You get +2 [willpower] for this test. If you succeed you discover 1 additional clue at this location. If you fail, shuffle 1 non-weakness asset from your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Brute Force
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
While Brute Force is committed during a basic fight action, it gains [combat] and the text: "If this test is successful by 1 or more, this attack deals +1 damage."

cards.name: Faithful
cards.text: If this test would be successful, reveal 5 additional tokens from the chaos bag. Cancel all non-[elder_sign] tokens revealed this way.

cards.name: Infuse Strength
cards.text:
Uses (4 Charges). If this card has no charges, discard it.
For the purpose of counting icons committed to skill tests, [willpower] icons on your cards count as matching icons.
[reaction] When you initiate a skill test on an event card that does not use or add your [willpower], exhaust Infuse Strength or spend 1 charge: Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this test. If you fail, remove 1 charge from Infuse Strength.

cards.name: Faithful
cards.text: If this test would be successful, reveal 10 additional tokens from the chaos bag. Cancel all non-[elder_sign] tokens revealed this way. If the [elder_sign] token wasn't resolved this test, draw 1 card.

cards.flavor: "It is said that they put their very soul into that strike. In the light that followed, the world escaped a terrible fate, and lost its greatest hero."
cards.name: The Strike to end an Age
cards.text: Exceptional. Fight. Resolve a Fight action on a Melee asset you control, ignoring it's [action] cost. If you succeed, deal 2 damage to each enemy at your location. If at least 1 enemy is defeated during this attack, return a Blessed card from your discard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "Not a single soul survived that day, but their resolve has never wavered. They will push back the darkness with everything they once had."
cards.name: Souls of the Forgotten
cards.text: Exceptional. Fight. This attack targets the enemy in play with the highest fight. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this attack. This attack deals +4 damage. If you would succeed, reveal the [elder_sign] token, then resolve it.

cards.name: Fixer
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn. 
During your next action this turn, set the base value of one of your skills to 5 and you ignore attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] When you play Fixer, increase its cost by 2: Change "your skills to 5" to "your skills to 7".
[reaction] When you play Fixer, increase its cost by 2: Change "your next action this turn" to "this turn"

cards.name: Rendezvous
cards.text: Move: Move 1 investigator at your location to a revealed location up to 3 connections away from you. [reaction] When you play Rendezvous, increase its cost by 2: Change "Move 1 investigator" to "Move 2 investigators". [reaction] When you play Rendezvous, increase its cost by 2: Change "your location" to "any location".

cards.name: Crackdown
cards.text:
Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] When you play Crackdown, increase its cost by 2: Change "Deal 2 damage" to "Deal 3 damage."
[reaction] When you play Crackdown, increase its cost by 2: Change "an enemy at your location." to "each enemy at your location."

cards.name: Scouting Network
cards.text: Fast. Play when a non-Elite enemy spawns. That enemy enters your location exhausted. Deal 1 damage to it. [reaction] When you play Scouting Network, increase its cost by 2. Change "1 damage." to "3 damage." [reaction] When you play Scouting Network, increase its cost by 2: Change "spawns" to "enters your location".

cards.name: Ring of Desire
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] After Ring of Desire enters play and after your turn begins, choose one of you skills with the lowest base value: Increase the base value of that skill by 1 until the start of your next turn. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Search Party
cards.text: Fast. Play only during your turn. Reduced the cost of Search Party by 1 for each Acquaintance asset in your discard. Choose up to 2 Acquaintance assets in your discard pile. Return the chosen cards to your hand. You may put an Acquaintance asset into play.

cards.name: Lenora Howard
cards.text:
You get +1 [combat] and +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you evade an enemy, exhaust Lenora Howard: Engage an enemy at your location and/or take a fight action.

cards.name: Following the Script
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
You may commit Following the Script to any type of test.
When this skill test would succeed, resolve the [elder_sign] effect on your investigator card. Then. remove this card from the game.

cards.name: Errand Boy
cards.text:
Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] After Errand Boy enters play: You get +2 skill value during your next text the round.
[reaction] After your turn begins or ends, discard Errand Boy: Gain 2 resources.

cards.name: Fade Existence
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). If Fade Existence has no charges, discard it or spend 1 resource to shuffle it into your deck. [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. You may immediately engage an enemy at your location. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you fail, shuffle 1 non-weakness skill from your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Fade Existence
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). If Fade Existence has no charges, discard it or spend 1 resource to shuffle it into your deck. [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. You may immediately engage an enemy at your location. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +2 [willpower] for this test. If you fail, shuffle 1 non-weakness skill from your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Fade Existence
cards.text: Uses (4 charges). If Fade Existence has no charges, discard it or shuffle it into your deck. [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. You may immediately engage an enemy at your location. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +3 [willpower] for this test If you fail, shuffle 1 non-weakness skill from your hand into your deck.

cards.flavor: "It's time to take it back."
cards.name: Repossession Contract
cards.text: Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] When loot is place on a card you control, exhaust Repossession Contract: Place 1 additional loot on that card. Forced After Repossession Contract enter play: Search your bonded cards for Prowler and Shadowfoot. Put them into play.

cards.name: Chronicon Eternum
cards.text: Limit 1 per deck. You maybe only play Chronicon Eternum while you have 7 other cards in hand. Forced When your turn ends, if you have no cards in hand: Discard Drawn to Darkness and draw 3 cards. Record in your campaign log that "you have identified the timeline."

cards.name: Chronicon Eternum
cards.text:
Researched. Uses (4 Fates). Limit 1 per deck.
[reaction] After you resolve an [action] ability, exhaust Chronicon Eternum and spend 1 fate: Resolve its effects again, ignoring all costs. You get +2 skill value while resolving that ability.

cards.name: Chronicon Eternum
cards.text:
Researched. Uses (4 Fates). Limit 1 per deck.
[reaction] After an investigator at your location fails a skill test, exhaust Chronicon Eternum and spend 1 fate: That investigator draws 2 cards and gains an additional action this round.

cards.name: Chronicon Eternum
cards.text: Researched. Uses (4 Fates). Limit 1 per deck. [action] Exhaust Chronicon Eternum: Investigate. If you succeed, you may spend 1 fate and place 1 clue on your location. Then place a non-Elite enemy at your location on top of the encounter deck. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Orne's Special
cards.text: Uses (3 ammo). Supply cards cannot be attached to this card. [action] If the Orne's Special is ready, spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +3 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +2 damage. [reaction] After you defeat an enemy while the Orne's Special has no remaining ammo on it, exhaust the Orne's Special: Replenish the ammo on this card.
